definition: to start rumours and create trouble
to mislead the public with rumors/to delude the people with lies
to take heed of idle chatter (idiom)

sentences.english: But there are already murmurs that it's much worse than that.
sentences.chinese: 但已有許多謠言說那是比扭傷更嚴重多了。

sentences.english: I’ve heard a whisper that old Bill’s going to lose his job next month.
sentences.chinese: 謠傳說老比爾下個月要丟差事了。

sentences.english: We heard a whisper that you have been arrested.
sentences.chinese: 我們聽到一個謠言說你被拘繫了。

sentences.english: Urban myths abound about the birds being able to disembowel a man with their claws.
sentences.chinese: 城市裏流傳着一些謠傳說鶴鴕能用爪子挖出人的內臟。

sentences.english: She rounded upon him in the office,charging him with telling lies about her.
sentences.chinese: 她在辦公室裏對他大發雷霆，指責他造她的謠。

sentences.english: Rumour has it that Damien Plessis could be leaving Liverpool this week?
sentences.chinese: 謠言說這周普萊斯西離開利物浦？

definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
ode/eulogy/to praise in writing/to wish (in letters)
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with
abbr. for Ukraine 烏克蘭|乌克兰[Wu1 ke4 lan2]/surname Wu
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
abbr. for Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region 寧夏回族自治區|宁夏回族自治区[Ning2 xia4 Hui2 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 qu1]/abbr. for Nanjing 南京[Nan2 jing1]/surname Ning
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to gather up/to collect/to edit/to compile
